name: User Research Methods
description: Comprehensive skill for conducting user research including interviews, surveys, usability testing, and data analysis. Covers research planning, participant recruitment, data collection, and insight generation for user-centered design.

dependencies.reason: Fundamental UX knowledge is required for effective user research

restrictions: Focus on usability testing and user feedback collection
enhancements: Understanding of user needs and pain points

restrictions: Focus on user requirement gathering and validation
enhancements: User research integration into system design

capabilities.name: Research Planning
capabilities.description: Design comprehensive research plans with objectives, methodologies, and success metrics

implementation.approach: Define research questions, hypotheses, and appropriate methodologies to answer them

capabilities.name: User Interviews
capabilities.description: Conduct effective user interviews to gather qualitative insights and user needs

implementation.approach: Prepare interview guides, conduct sessions, and analyze qualitative data

capabilities.name: Survey Design
capabilities.description: Create effective surveys with proper question formulation and response scaling

implementation.approach: Design unbiased questions, choose appropriate question types, and ensure statistical validity

capabilities.name: Usability Testing
capabilities.description: Conduct usability tests to evaluate interface effectiveness and identify usability issues

implementation.approach: Plan test scenarios, facilitate sessions, and document usability issues and recommendations

capabilities.name: Data Analysis
capabilities.description: Analyze qualitative and quantitative research data to generate actionable insights

implementation.approach: Apply appropriate analysis methods to different data types and identify patterns and insights

capabilities.name: Participant Recruitment
capabilities.description: Recruit and manage research participants with appropriate screening and scheduling

implementation.approach: Define recruitment criteria, screen participants, and manage scheduling and incentives

capabilities.name: Research Reporting
capabilities.description: Create comprehensive research reports with findings, insights, and recommendations

implementation.approach: Structure reports with clear methodology, findings, and actionable recommendations

examples.title: E-commerce Website User Research
examples.scenario: Conduct comprehensive user research for an e-commerce website redesign to understand user behaviors, pain points, and improvement opportunities
steps: Define research objectives and key questions
Conduct user interviews about shopping behaviors
Design and distribute user satisfaction survey
Conduct usability testing of current website
code: 'Understand current user shopping behaviors and pain points',
'How do users currently navigate the website to find products?',
script: 'Thank you for participating today. We're researching how people shop online to improve our website. This interview will take about 45 minutes.'
'Can you walk me through how you typically shop for products online?',
'What websites or apps do you use most frequently for shopping?',
'What factors influence your decision to purchase from a particular website?',
'Can you tell me about a recent online shopping experience you had?'
script: 'Thank you for sharing your insights. Your feedback will help us improve our website for all users.'
{ type: 'multiple-choice', question: 'Gender', options: ['Male', 'Female', 'Non-binary', 'Prefer not to say'] }
{ type: 'frequency', question: 'How often do you shop online?', scale: ['Daily', 'Weekly', 'Monthly', 'Rarely', 'Never'] },
{ type: 'ranking', question: 'Rank these factors in order of importance when shopping online', options: ['Price', 'Quality', 'Shipping speed', 'Return policy', 'Customer reviews'] }
{ type: 'likert', question: 'Overall satisfaction with online shopping experiences', scale: '1-5' },
{ type: 'likert', question: 'Ease of finding products on most websites', scale: '1-5' }
outcomes: Comprehensive understanding of user shopping behaviors and preferences
Identification of key pain points and improvement opportunities
Validated user personas and journey maps
Stakeholder alignment on user experience priorities

knownIssues: Participant recruitment challenges and scheduling conflicts
Research bias and subjectivity in qualitative data
Statistical significance issues with small sample sizes

versionHistory.notes: Initial release with comprehensive user research methodology capabilities
